title: How to Export Certificate Public Key from Chrome

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Open the menu at the top right corner and select "Settings"

steps.title: Select Show Advanced Settings > Manage Certificates
steps.content: Select Show Advanced Settings > Manage Certificates

steps.title: Select the certificate you wanted to export then click "Export" button then next
steps.content: Select the certificate you wanted to export then click "Export" button then next

steps.title: Now, you will get a "Certificate Export Wizard" box.
steps.content: Now, you will get a "Certificate Export Wizard" box. Just click "Next"

steps.title: Select "No, do not export the private key" then click next
steps.content: Select "No, do not export the private key" then click next

steps.title: Select "DER encoded binary x.509(.cer) then click next
steps.content: Select "DER encoded binary x.509(.cer) then click next

steps.title: Browse a folder where you wanted to save the file and assign a filename then click "Save"
steps.content: Browse a folder where you wanted to save the file and assign a filename then click "Save"

steps.title: Click finish to complete the wizard.
steps.content: Click finish to complete the wizard. Now you can locate the file where you saved it.
